intro: Solena mussaendae, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant features elliptical, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are clustered in terminal panicles and bloom in the summer months. Solena mussaendae is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and adaptability to various growing conditions.
